00029 #include "mount_utils.h"
00030 #include <stddef.h>
00031 #include <stdio.h>
00032 #include <string.h>
00033 #include <libzfs.h>
00034 
00035 /* Persistent mount data is stored in these user attributes */
00036 #define LDD_PREFIX              "lustre:"
00037 #define LDD_VERSION_PROP        LDD_PREFIX "version"
00038 #define LDD_FLAGS_PROP          LDD_PREFIX "flags"
00039 #define LDD_INDEX_PROP          LDD_PREFIX "index"
00040 #define LDD_FSNAME_PROP         LDD_PREFIX "fsname"
00041 #define LDD_SVNAME_PROP         LDD_PREFIX "svname"
00042 #define LDD_UUID_PROP           LDD_PREFIX "uuid"
00043 #define LDD_USERDATA_PROP       LDD_PREFIX "userdata"
00044 #define LDD_MOUNTOPTS_PROP      LDD_PREFIX "mountopts"
00045 
00046 /* This structure is used to help bridge the gap between the ZFS
00047  * properties Lustre uses and their corresponding internal LDD fields.
00048  * It is meant to be used internally by the mount utility only. */
00049 struct zfs_ldd_prop_bridge {
00050         /* Contains the publicly visible name for the property
00051          * (i.e. what is shown when running "zfs get") */
00052         char *zlpb_prop_name;
00053         /* Contains the offset into the lustre_disk_data structure where
00054          * the value of this property is or will be stored. (i.e. the
00055          * property is read from and written to this offset within ldd) */
00056         int   zlpb_ldd_offset;
00057         /* Function pointer responsible for reading in the @prop
00058          * property from @zhp and storing it in @ldd_field */
00059         int (*zlpb_get_prop_fn)(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *ldd_field);
00060         /* Function pointer responsible for writing the value of @ldd_field
00061          * into the @prop dataset property in @zhp */
00062         int (*zlpb_set_prop_fn)(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *ldd_field);
00063 };
00064 
00065 /* Forward declarations needed to initialize the ldd prop bridge list */
00066 static int zfs_get_prop_int(zfs_handle_t *, char *, void *);
00067 static int zfs_set_prop_int(zfs_handle_t *, char *, void *);
00068 static int zfs_get_prop_str(zfs_handle_t *, char *, void *);
00069 static int zfs_set_prop_str(zfs_handle_t *, char *, void *);
00070 
00071 /* Helper for initializing the entries in the special_ldd_prop_params list.
00072  *    - @name: stored directly in the zlpb_prop_name field
00073  *             (e.g. lustre:fsname, lustre:version, etc.)
00074  *    - @field: the field in the lustre_disk_data which directly maps to
00075  *              the @name property. (e.g. ldd_fsname, ldd_config_ver, etc.)
00076  *    - @type: The type of @field. Only "int" and "str" are supported.
00077  */
00078 #define ZLB_INIT(name, field, type)                     \
00079 {                                                       \
00080         name, offsetof(struct lustre_disk_data, field), \
00081         zfs_get_prop_ ## type, zfs_set_prop_ ## type    \
00082 }
00083 
00084 /* These ldd properties are special because they all have their own
00085  * individual fields in the lustre_disk_data structure, as opposed to
00086  * being globbed into the ldd_params field. As such, these need special
00087  * handling when reading/writing the ldd structure to/from persistent
00088  * storage. */
00089 struct zfs_ldd_prop_bridge special_ldd_prop_params[] = {
00090         ZLB_INIT(LDD_VERSION_PROP,   ldd_config_ver, int),
00091         ZLB_INIT(LDD_FLAGS_PROP,     ldd_flags,      int),
00092         ZLB_INIT(LDD_INDEX_PROP,     ldd_svindex,    int),
00093         ZLB_INIT(LDD_FSNAME_PROP,    ldd_fsname,     str),
00094         ZLB_INIT(LDD_SVNAME_PROP,    ldd_svname,     str),
00095         ZLB_INIT(LDD_UUID_PROP,      ldd_uuid,       str),
00096         ZLB_INIT(LDD_USERDATA_PROP,  ldd_userdata,   str),
00097         ZLB_INIT(LDD_MOUNTOPTS_PROP, ldd_mount_opts, str),
00098         { NULL }
00099 };
00100 
00101 /* indicate if the ZFS OSD has been successfully setup */
00102 static int osd_zfs_setup = 0;
00103 
00104 static libzfs_handle_t *g_zfs;
00105 
00106 void zfs_fini(void);
00107 
00108 static int zfs_set_prop_int(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *val)
00109 {
00110         char str[64];
00111         int ret;
00112 
00113         (void) snprintf(str, sizeof (str), "%i", *(int *)val);
00114         vprint("  %s=%s\n", prop, str);
00115         ret = zfs_prop_set(zhp, prop, str);
00116 
00117         return ret;
00118 }
00119 
00120 /*
00121  * Write the zfs property string, note that properties with a NULL or
00122  * zero-length value will not be written and 0 returned.
00123  */
00124 static int zfs_set_prop_str(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *val)
00125 {
00126         int ret = 0;
00127 
00128         if (val && strlen(val) > 0) {
00129                 vprint("  %s=%s\n", prop, (char *)val);
00130                 ret = zfs_prop_set(zhp, prop, (char *)val);
00131         }
00132 
00133         return ret;
00134 }
00135 
00136 /*
00137  * Map '<key>=<value> ...' pairs in the passed string to dataset properties
00138  * of the form 'lustre:<key>=<value>'.  Malformed <key>=<value> pairs will
00139  * be skipped.
00140  */
00141 static int zfs_set_prop_params(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *params)
00142 {
00143         char *params_dup, *token, *key, *value;
00144         char *save_token = NULL;
00145         char prop_name[ZFS_MAXNAMELEN];
00146         int ret = 0;
00147 
00148         params_dup = strdup(params);
00149         if (params_dup == NULL)
00150                 return ENOMEM;
00151 
00152         token = strtok_r(params_dup, " ", &save_token);
00153         while (token) {
00154                 key = strtok(token, "=");
00155                 if (key == NULL)
00156                         continue;
00157 
00158                 value = strtok(NULL, "=");
00159                 if (value == NULL)
00160                         continue;
00161 
00162                 sprintf(prop_name, "%s%s", LDD_PREFIX, key);
00163                 vprint("  %s=%s\n", prop_name, value);
00164 
00165                 ret = zfs_prop_set(zhp, prop_name, value);
00166                 if (ret)
00167                         break;
00168 
00169                 token = strtok_r(NULL, " ", &save_token);
00170         }
00171 
00172         free(params_dup);
00173 
00174         return ret;
00175 }
00176 
00177 static int osd_check_zfs_setup(void)
00178 {
00179         if (osd_zfs_setup == 0) {
00180                 /* setup failed */
00181                 fatal();
00182                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to initialize ZFS library. Are the ZFS "
00183                         "packages and modules correctly installed?\n");
00184         }
00185         return osd_zfs_setup == 1;
00186 }
00187 
00188 /* Write the server config as properties associated with the dataset */
00189 int zfs_write_ldd(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00190 {
00191         struct lustre_disk_data *ldd = &mop->mo_ldd;
00192         char *ds = mop->mo_device;
00193         zfs_handle_t *zhp;
00194         struct zfs_ldd_prop_bridge *bridge;
00195         int i, ret = EINVAL;
00196 
00197         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00198                 return EINVAL;
00199 
00200         zhp = zfs_open(g_zfs, ds, ZFS_TYPE_FILESYSTEM);
00201         if (zhp == NULL) {
00202                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to open zfs dataset %s\n", ds);
00203                 goto out;
00204         }
00205 
00206         vprint("Writing %s properties\n", ds);
00207 
00208         for (i = 0; special_ldd_prop_params[i].zlpb_prop_name != NULL; i++) {
00209                 bridge = &special_ldd_prop_params[i];
00210                 ret = bridge->zlpb_set_prop_fn(zhp, bridge->zlpb_prop_name,
00211                                         (void *)ldd + bridge->zlpb_ldd_offset);
00212                 if (ret)
00213                         goto out_close;
00214         }
00215 
00216         ret = zfs_set_prop_params(zhp, ldd->ldd_params);
00217 
00218 out_close:
00219         zfs_close(zhp);
00220 out:
00221         return ret;
00222 }
00223 
00224 static int zfs_get_prop_int(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *val)
00225 {
00226         nvlist_t *propval;
00227         char *propstr;
00228         int ret;
00229 
00230         ret = nvlist_lookup_nvlist(zfs_get_user_props(zhp), prop, &propval);
00231         if (ret)
00232                 return ret;
00233 
00234         ret = nvlist_lookup_string(propval, ZPROP_VALUE, &propstr);
00235         if (ret)
00236                 return ret;
00237 
00238         errno = 0;
00239         *(__u32 *)val = strtoul(propstr, NULL, 10);
00240         if (errno)
00241                 return errno;
00242 
00243         return ret;
00244 }
00245 
00246 static int zfs_get_prop_str(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *prop, void *val)
00247 {
00248         nvlist_t *propval;
00249         char *propstr;
00250         int ret;
00251 
00252         ret = nvlist_lookup_nvlist(zfs_get_user_props(zhp), prop, &propval);
00253         if (ret)
00254                 return ret;
00255 
00256         ret = nvlist_lookup_string(propval, ZPROP_VALUE, &propstr);
00257         if (ret)
00258                 return ret;
00259 
00260         (void) strcpy(val, propstr);
00261 
00262         return ret;
00263 }
00264 
00265 static int zfs_is_special_ldd_prop_param(char *name)
00266 {
00267         int i;
00268 
00269         for (i = 0; special_ldd_prop_params[i].zlpb_prop_name != NULL; i++)
00270                 if (!strcmp(name, special_ldd_prop_params[i].zlpb_prop_name))
00271                         return 1;
00272 
00273         return 0;
00274 }
00275 
00276 static int zfs_get_prop_params(zfs_handle_t *zhp, char *param, int len)
00277 {
00278         nvlist_t *props;
00279         nvpair_t *nvp;
00280         char key[ZFS_MAXNAMELEN];
00281         char *value;
00282         int ret = 0;
00283 
00284         props = zfs_get_user_props(zhp);
00285         if (props == NULL)
00286                 return ENOENT;
00287 
00288         value = malloc(len);
00289         if (value == NULL)
00290                 return ENOMEM;
00291 
00292         nvp = NULL;
00293         while (nvp = nvlist_next_nvpair(props, nvp), nvp) {
00294                 ret = zfs_get_prop_str(zhp, nvpair_name(nvp), value);
00295                 if (ret)
00296                         break;
00297 
00298                 if (strncmp(nvpair_name(nvp), LDD_PREFIX, strlen(LDD_PREFIX)))
00299                         continue;
00300 
00301                 if (zfs_is_special_ldd_prop_param(nvpair_name(nvp)))
00302                         continue;
00303 
00304                 sprintf(key, "%s=",  nvpair_name(nvp) + strlen(LDD_PREFIX));
00305 
00306                 ret = add_param(param, key, value);
00307                 if (ret)
00308                         break;
00309         }
00310 
00311         free(value);
00312 
00313         return ret;
00314 }
00315 
00316 /*
00317  * Read the server config as properties associated with the dataset.
00318  * Missing entries as not treated error and are simply skipped.
00319  */
00320 int zfs_read_ldd(char *ds,  struct lustre_disk_data *ldd)
00321 {
00322         zfs_handle_t *zhp;
00323         struct zfs_ldd_prop_bridge *bridge;
00324         int i, ret = EINVAL;
00325 
00326         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00327                 return EINVAL;
00328 
00329         zhp = zfs_open(g_zfs, ds, ZFS_TYPE_FILESYSTEM);
00330         if (zhp == NULL)
00331                 goto out;
00332 
00333         for (i = 0; special_ldd_prop_params[i].zlpb_prop_name != NULL; i++) {
00334                 bridge = &special_ldd_prop_params[i];
00335                 ret = bridge->zlpb_get_prop_fn(zhp, bridge->zlpb_prop_name,
00336                                         (void *)ldd + bridge->zlpb_ldd_offset);
00337                 if (ret && (ret != ENOENT))
00338                         goto out_close;
00339         }
00340 
00341         ret = zfs_get_prop_params(zhp, ldd->ldd_params, 4096);
00342         if (ret && (ret != ENOENT))
00343                 goto out_close;
00344 
00345         ldd->ldd_mount_type = LDD_MT_ZFS;
00346         ret = 0;
00347 out_close:
00348         zfs_close(zhp);
00349 out:
00350         return ret;
00351 }
00352 
00353 int zfs_is_lustre(char *ds, unsigned *mount_type)
00354 {
00355         struct lustre_disk_data tmp_ldd;
00356         int ret;
00357 
00358         if (osd_zfs_setup == 0)
00359                 return 0;
00360 
00361         ret = zfs_read_ldd(ds, &tmp_ldd);
00362         if ((ret == 0) && (tmp_ldd.ldd_config_ver > 0) &&
00363             (strlen(tmp_ldd.ldd_svname) > 0)) {
00364                 *mount_type = tmp_ldd.ldd_mount_type;
00365                 return 1;
00366         }
00367 
00368         return 0;
00369 }
00370 
00371 static char *zfs_mkfs_opts(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *str, int len)
00372 {
00373         memset(str, 0, len);
00374 
00375         if (strlen(mop->mo_mkfsopts) != 0)
00376                 snprintf(str, len, " -o %s", mop->mo_mkfsopts);
00377 
00378         return str;
00379 }
00380 
00381 static int zfs_create_vdev(struct mkfs_opts *mop, char *vdev)
00382 {
00383         int ret = 0;
00384 
00385         /* Silently ignore reserved vdev names */
00386         if ((strncmp(vdev, "disk", 4) == 0) ||
00387             (strncmp(vdev, "file", 4) == 0) ||
00388             (strncmp(vdev, "mirror", 6) == 0) ||
00389             (strncmp(vdev, "raidz", 5) == 0) ||
00390             (strncmp(vdev, "spare", 5) == 0) ||
00391             (strncmp(vdev, "log", 3) == 0) ||
00392             (strncmp(vdev, "cache", 5) == 0))
00393                 return ret;
00394 
00395         /*
00396          * Verify a file exists at the provided absolute path.  If it doesn't
00397          * and mo_device_kb is set attempt to create a file vdev to be used.
00398          * Relative paths will be passed directly to 'zpool create' which
00399          * will check multiple multiple locations under /dev/.
00400          */
00401         if (vdev[0] == '/') {
00402                 ret = access(vdev, F_OK);
00403                 if (ret == 0)
00404                         return ret;
00405 
00406                 ret = errno;
00407                 if (ret != ENOENT) {
00408                         fatal();
00409                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to access required vdev "
00410                                 "for pool %s (%d)\n", vdev, ret);
00411                         return ret;
00412                 }
00413 
00414                 if (mop->mo_device_kb == 0) {
00415                         fatal();
00416                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create vdev due to "
00417                                 "missing --device-size=#N(KB) parameter\n");
00418                         return EINVAL;
00419                 }
00420 
00421                 ret = file_create(vdev, mop->mo_device_kb);
00422                 if (ret) {
00423                         fatal();
00424                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create vdev %s (%d)\n",
00425                                 vdev, ret);
00426                         return ret;
00427                 }
00428         }
00429 
00430         return ret;
00431 }
00432 
00433 int zfs_make_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00434 {
00435         zfs_handle_t *zhp;
00436         zpool_handle_t *php;
00437         char *pool = NULL;
00438         char *mkfs_cmd = NULL;
00439         char *mkfs_tmp = NULL;
00440         char *ds = mop->mo_device;
00441         int pool_exists = 0, ret;
00442 
00443         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00444                 return EINVAL;
00445 
00446         /* no automatic index with zfs backend */
00447         if (mop->mo_ldd.ldd_flags & LDD_F_NEED_INDEX) {
00448                 fatal();
00449                 fprintf(stderr, "The target index must be specified with "
00450                                 "--index\n");
00451                 return EINVAL;
00452         }
00453 
00454         pool = strdup(ds);
00455         if (pool == NULL)
00456                 return ENOMEM;
00457 
00458         mkfs_cmd = malloc(PATH_MAX);
00459         if (mkfs_cmd == NULL) {
00460                 ret = ENOMEM;
00461                 goto out;
00462         }
00463 
00464         mkfs_tmp = malloc(PATH_MAX);
00465         if (mkfs_tmp == NULL) {
00466                 ret = ENOMEM;
00467                 goto out;
00468         }
00469 
00470         /* Due to zfs_prepare_lustre() check the '/' must exist */
00471         strchr(pool, '/')[0] = '\0';
00472 
00473         /* If --reformat was given attempt to destroy the previous dataset */
00474         if ((mop->mo_flags & MO_FORCEFORMAT) &&
00475             ((zhp = zfs_open(g_zfs, ds, ZFS_TYPE_FILESYSTEM)) != NULL)) {
00476 
00477                 ret = zfs_destroy(zhp, 0);
00478                 if (ret) {
00479                         zfs_close(zhp);
00480                         fprintf(stderr, "Failed destroy zfs dataset %s (%d)\n",
00481                                 ds, ret);
00482                         goto out;
00483                 }
00484 
00485                 zfs_close(zhp);
00486         }
00487 
00488         /*
00489          * Create the zpool if the vdevs have been specified and the pool
00490          * does not already exists.  The pool creation itself will be done
00491          * with the zpool command rather than the zpool_create() library call
00492          * so the existing zpool error handling can be leveraged.
00493          */
00494         php = zpool_open(g_zfs, pool);
00495         if (php) {
00496                 pool_exists = 1;
00497                 zpool_close(php);
00498         }
00499 
00500         if ((mop->mo_pool_vdevs != NULL) && (pool_exists == 0)) {
00501 
00502                 memset(mkfs_cmd, 0, PATH_MAX);
00503                 snprintf(mkfs_cmd, PATH_MAX,
00504                         "zpool create -f -O canmount=off %s", pool);
00505 
00506                 /* Append the vdev config and create file vdevs as required */
00507                 while (*mop->mo_pool_vdevs != NULL) {
00508                         strscat(mkfs_cmd, " ", PATH_MAX);
00509                         strscat(mkfs_cmd, *mop->mo_pool_vdevs, PATH_MAX);
00510 
00511                         ret = zfs_create_vdev(mop, *mop->mo_pool_vdevs);
00512                         if (ret)
00513                                 goto out;
00514 
00515                         mop->mo_pool_vdevs++;
00516                 }
00517 
00518                 vprint("mkfs_cmd = %s\n", mkfs_cmd);
00519                 ret = run_command(mkfs_cmd, PATH_MAX);
00520                 if (ret) {
00521                         fatal();
00522                         fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create pool %s (%d)\n",
00523                                 pool, ret);
00524                         goto out;
00525                 }
00526         }
00527 
00528         /*
00529          * Create the ZFS filesystem with any required mkfs options:
00530          * - canmount=off is set to prevent zfs automounting
00531          * - xattr=sa is set to use system attribute based xattrs
00532          */
00533         memset(mkfs_cmd, 0, PATH_MAX);
00534         snprintf(mkfs_cmd, PATH_MAX,
00535                  "zfs create -o canmount=off -o xattr=sa%s %s",
00536                  zfs_mkfs_opts(mop, mkfs_tmp, PATH_MAX), ds);
00537 
00538         vprint("mkfs_cmd = %s\n", mkfs_cmd);
00539         ret = run_command(mkfs_cmd, PATH_MAX);
00540         if (ret) {
00541                 fatal();
00542                 fprintf(stderr, "Unable to create filesystem %s (%d)\n",
00543                         ds, ret);
00544                 goto out;
00545         }
00546 
00547 out:
00548         if (pool != NULL)
00549                 free(pool);
00550 
00551         if (mkfs_cmd != NULL)
00552                 free(mkfs_cmd);
00553 
00554         if (mkfs_tmp != NULL)
00555                 free(mkfs_tmp);
00556 
00557         return ret;
00558 }
00559 
00560 int zfs_enable_quota(struct mkfs_opts *mop)
00561 {
00562         fprintf(stderr, "this option is not only valid for zfs\n");
00563         return ENOSYS;
00564 }
00565 
00566 int zfs_prepare_lustre(struct mkfs_opts *mop,
00567                        char *wanted_mountopts, size_t len)
00568 {
00569         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00570                 return EINVAL;
00571 
00572         if (zfs_name_valid(mop->mo_device, ZFS_TYPE_FILESYSTEM) == 0) {
00573                 fatal();
00574                 fprintf(stderr, "Invalid filesystem name %s\n", mop->mo_device);
00575                 return EINVAL;
00576         }
00577 
00578         if (strchr(mop->mo_device, '/') == NULL) {
00579                 fatal();
00580                 fprintf(stderr, "Missing pool in filesystem name %s\n",
00581                         mop->mo_device);
00582                 return EINVAL;
00583         }
00584 
00585         return 0;
00586 }
00587 
00588 int zfs_tune_lustre(char *dev, struct mount_opts *mop)
00589 {
00590         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00591                 return EINVAL;
00592 
00593         return 0;
00594 }
00595 
00596 int zfs_label_lustre(struct mount_opts *mop)
00597 {
00598         zfs_handle_t *zhp;
00599         int ret;
00600 
00601         if (osd_check_zfs_setup() == 0)
00602                 return EINVAL;
00603 
00604         zhp = zfs_open(g_zfs, mop->mo_source, ZFS_TYPE_FILESYSTEM);
00605         if (zhp == NULL)
00606                 return EINVAL;
00607 
00608         ret = zfs_set_prop_str(zhp, LDD_SVNAME_PROP, mop->mo_ldd.ldd_svname);
00609         zfs_close(zhp);
00610 
00611         return ret;
00612 }
00613 
00614 int zfs_init(void)
00615 {
00616         int ret = 0;
00617 
00618         g_zfs = libzfs_init();
00619         if (g_zfs == NULL) {
00620                 fprintf(stderr, "Failed to initialize ZFS library\n");
00621                 ret = EINVAL;
00622         } else {
00623                 osd_zfs_setup = 1;
00624         }
00625 
00626         return ret;
00627 }
00628 
00629 void zfs_fini(void)
00630 {
00631         if (g_zfs) {
00632                 libzfs_fini(g_zfs);
00633                 g_zfs = NULL;
00634         }
00635         osd_zfs_setup = 0;
00636 }
